A bespoke ggplot2 theme that embodies a company's brand identity. Using this theme not only enhances the visual appeal of plots but also ensures consistency across all graphical outputs, reinforcing the brandâ€™s presence and professionalism. This theme implements our unique color palette, typography, and stylistic elements. By integrating these brand-specific features into our data visualizations, we aim to provide a cohesive and recognizable look that aligns with our corporate values and aesthetic standards, thereby facilitating clearer communication and a stronger brand connection with our audience.

## Graph Gallery

### Stacked Coloumn

```{r column, echo=FALSE}
# Sample data for product category sales (replace with actual data)
category_sales <- data.frame(
  category = c("Electronics", "Clothing", "Home", "Sports"),
  sales = c(1500, 1200, 1100, 900)
)

# Plot
ggplot(category_sales, aes(x = category, y = sales, fill = category)) +
  geom_col() +
  labs(title = "Product Category Sales",
       x = "Category",
       y = "Sales ($)",
       caption = "Source: Company Sales Data") +
  theme_exploristics() 

```

### Time Series

```{r, echo=FALSE}
# Sample data for sales performance (replace with actual data)
sales_data <- data.frame(
  date = seq(as.Date("2023-01-01"), by = "month", length.out = 12),
  sales = c(500, 450, 480, 520, 530, 560, 600, 590, 610, 630, 650, 670)
)

# Plot
ggplot(sales_data, aes(x = date, y = sales)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_line() +
  labs(title = "Sales Performance Over Time",
       x = "Date",
       y = "Sales ($)",
       caption = "Source: Company Sales Data") +
  theme_exploristics()
```

### Boxplot

```{r boxplot, echo=FALSE}
# Sample data for customer demographics (replace with actual data)
customer_data <- data.frame(
  age = sample(18:70, 200, replace = TRUE)
)

# Plot
ggplot(customer_data, aes(x = "", y = age)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  labs(title = "Customer Age Distribution",
       x = "Customer",
       y = "Age",
       caption = "Source: Company Customer Data") +
  theme_exploristics()

```

### Violin

```{r violin, echo=FALSE}
# Sample data for sales by region (replace with actual data)
set.seed(123)
region_sales <- data.frame(
  region = rep(c("North", "South", "East", "West"), each = 50),
  sales = c(rnorm(50, mean = 5000, sd = 1000),
            rnorm(50, mean = 3000, sd = 800),
            rnorm(50, mean = 4000, sd = 900),
            rnorm(50, mean = 3500, sd = 700))
)

# Plot
ggplot(region_sales, aes(x = region, y = sales, fill = region)) +
  geom_violin() +
  labs(title = "Sales Distribution by Region",
       x = "Region",
       y = "Sales ($)",
       caption = "Source: Company Sales Data") +
  theme_exploristics()
```


## Installation

Currently the ExploristicsTheme package is stored on the Exploristics GitHub [GitHub repo](https://github.com/Expl-DST). At present the repository is a private and requires permission to be granted by a member of the Data Science Team.

To install `ExploristicsTheme` package:

1.  Set up a GitHub account: [GitHub Signup](https://github.com/join)

2.  Enable Multi-Factor Authentication: [MFA Guide](https://docs.github.com/en/authentication/securing-your-account-with-two-factor-authentication-2fa/configuring-two-factor-authentication)

3.  Request access to `ExploristicsTheme` repository.

4.  Run the below code to install latest version of `ExploristicsTheme` package.

``` r
devtools::install_github("https://github.com/GABurns/ExploristicsTheme")
```
